intro: Casearia dolichanthera, commonly known as the long-flowered casearia, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Salicaceae, which includes willows and poplars, and is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by distinctive, elongated fruits. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
